item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (838 points | 251 comments)
2. CUNY paid Oracle $600M for its HR software (2013) (71 points | 13 comments)
3. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (85 points | 44 comments)
4. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (63 points | 18 comments)
5. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1293 points | 607 comments)
6. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (20 points | 1 comment)
7. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (50 points | 9 comments)
8. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (53 points | 36 comments)
9. Show HN: Selectric – macOS Search for Gmail, Outlook, Drive, Slack (7 points | 1 comment)
10. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (40 points | 4 comments)
11. The Dune Shell (85 points | 22 comments)
12. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (28 points | 10 comments)
13. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (16 points | 3 comments)
14. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (141 points | 47 comments)
15. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (350 points | 150 comments)
16. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (555 points | 295 comments)
17. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (41 points | 2 comments)
18. Twitter shut off API access; users volunteering their own data for an open API (23 points | 4 comments)
19. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (696 points | 189 comments)
20. Bankrupt Trucker Yellow Loses Ruling over $6.5B in Pension Debts (23 points | 21 comments)
21. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (23 points | 7 comments)
22. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (508 points | 180 comments)
23. Scientists discover how many chemicals from food packaging enter our bodies (44 points | 34 comments)
24. PeerTube 6.3 (101 points | 3 comments)
25. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (84 points | 35 comments)
26. Fine-Tuning LLMs to 1.58bit (22 points | 1 comment)
27. Show HN: Sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (108 points | 17 comments)
28. AI tool cuts unexpected deaths in hospital by 26%, Canadian study finds (142 points | 119 comments)
29. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (6 points | discuss)
30. Cuba slashes size of daily bread ration as ingredients run thin (6 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
